intro: Aganosma schlechteriana var. leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved aganosma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its ornamental value is often appreciated for its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
